response: The Cash Flow Available for Debt Service (CFADS) at the end of the first year, considering rental income, agency fees, maintenance, interest expense, and tax, is calculated as $17,258.80, which matches option a. 17,259.
The estimated closing debt principal outstanding at the end of year 4 is closest to option a. 820,296.

The calculated expected Internal Rate of Return (IRR) if the property is sold at the end of 10 years is approximately 12.3%. 

Among the given options: a. 9.2%, b. 10.2%, c. 11.2%, d. 12.2%, the closest correct choice is d. 12.2%.

The expected proceeds returned after selling the apartment after 2 years, after satisfying capital gains tax and repaying any outstanding debt, is approximately $930,343. Therefore, the correct choice is b. $930,343.
The highest IRR among the exit years is at Year 5 with an IRR of approximately 15.64%. Thus, the correct answer is b. Year 5.
